= fname =
 field: string '''.fname''' (Read-only)

The '''fname''' field is used to access the filename of a zone from a zone pointer (zoneptr).

== Description ==
The '''fname''' field returns the actual filename used to store the zone data on disk.

== Field Access ==
{| class="wikitable"
! Field !! Type !! Access !! Description
|-
| fname || string || Read-only || The filename of the zone
|}

== Availability ==
This field is available on the following unit types:
* zoneptr (Zone pointer)

== Examples ==
 dilbegin show_zone_filename();
 var
    z : zoneptr;
 code
 {
    z := zhead();
    
    if (length(z.fname) < 1)
        goto failure;
    
    send("Zone filename: " + z.fname, self);
    goto cleanup;

:failure:
    send("No filename available for this zone", self);
    
:cleanup:
    return;
 } dilend

== Usage Notes ==
* The field returns an empty string if no filename is available
* This is typically used for zone management and debugging purposes
